remarks: There is always a ` c ` distinct from ` B ` such that ` B ` lies between ` A ` and ` c ` .  Theorem 3.14 of [Schwabhauser] p. 32.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 24-Sep-2013.)
statement:
btwndiff $p |- ( ( N e. NN /\ A e. ( EE ` N ) /\ B e. ( EE ` N ) ) -> E. c e. ( EE ` N ) ( B Btwn <. A , c >. /\ B =/= c ) ) $.
$d A c $.
$d B c $.
$d N c $.
